sommaire
Protection Auto - Conditions générales EUR059H-0124
32La proposition ainsi faite constitue le conseil 
médical qui, dès qu’il est approuvé par vous-
même ou votre représentant, déclenche l’exécu -
tion des prestations et prescriptions médicales, 
telles qu’elles sont proposées par nos médecins.
> Transport ou rapatriement sanitaire
En application du conseil médical ci-dessus 
défini, notre médecin propose :
 • la poursuite du traitement sur le lieu d’assistan -
ce ou de l’établissement de premiers soins, un 
rapatriement pouvant être effectué ultérieure -
ment vers le domicile ou un établissement hos-
pitalier proche du domicile ;
 • le transfert de l’établissement de premiers soins 
vers un centre hospitalier local mieux adapté à 
votre état, le rapatriement vers un établissement 
proche du domicile ou directement au domicile 
étant organisé ultérieurement ;
 • le rapatriement du lieu d’assistance ou de l’éta -
blissement hospitalier de premiers soins vers un 
établissement proche du domicile ou directe -
ment au domicile.

> Transport ou rapatriement sanitaire
En application du conseil médical ci-dessus 
défini, notre médecin propose :
 • la poursuite du traitement sur le lieu d’assistan -
ce ou de l’établissement de premiers soins, un 
rapatriement pouvant être effectué ultérieure -
ment vers le domicile ou un établissement hos-
pitalier proche du domicile ;
 • le transfert de l’établissement de premiers soins 
vers un centre hospitalier local mieux adapté à 
votre état, le rapatriement vers un établissement 
proche du domicile ou directement au domicile 
étant organisé ultérieurement ;
 • le rapatriement du lieu d’assistance ou de l’éta -
blissement hospitalier de premiers soins vers un 
établissement proche du domicile ou directe -
ment au domicile.
Suivant votre état médical, les rapatriements 
ou transferts s’effectuent avec ou sans accom -
pagnateur (l’accompagnateur pouvant être 
médical, paramédical ou autre) par l’un des 
moyens paraissant le mieux adapté :
 • en ambulance, véhicule sanitaire léger (VSL) ou 
taxi ;
 •en avion de ligne régulière, en train  ;
 •en avion sanitaire ;
 • ou tout autre type de transport sanitaire ou 
public  ;
 • en utilisant votre véhicule conduit par un chauf -
feur qualifié, que nous envoyons.

45/60
CONSÉQUENCES DE CES DÉCLARATIONS SUR VOTRE CONTRAT
SI LA MODIFICATION CONSTITUE UNE AGGRAVATION DU RISQUE,
nous pouvons :
• soit proposer un produit adapté au nouveau risque,
•  soit proposer un avenant avec majoration de cotisation.

8/60
VOUS ET VOTRE CONTRAT
LE VÉHICULE ASSURÉ
C’est le véhicule terrestre à moteur, n’excédant pas 3,5 tonnes de poids total en charge,  désigné aux 
conditions particulières. Il est nommé « véhicule » dans les présentes conditions générales.
Il s’agit du modèle livré par le constructeur, avec les options prévues au catalogue et montées avant sa 
1ère mise en circulation.
Votre véhicule est garanti pour l’usage défini dans vos conditions particulières. Il n’est pas garanti en cas de 
location et de transport de personnes ou de marchandises, à titre onéreux.

llm_answer.text:
**Transport Options:**

* **Ground Ambulance:** A vehicle equipped with medical equipment and personnel to transport patients within a specific geographic area.
* **Air Ambulance:** A fixed-wing aircraft or helicopter equipped with medical equipment and personnel to transport patients over long distances or in emergency situations.
* **Commercial Airline:** A regular passenger airline that can accommodate patients with medical needs, such as oxygen therapy or stretcher transport.
* **Private Jet:** A chartered aircraft that can be customized to meet the specific medical needs of the patient.

**Medical Repatriation Options:**

* **Commercial Airline with Medical Escort:** A patient is transported on a commercial airline with a medical professional accompanying them to provide care and assistance.
* **Air Ambulance with Medical Team:** A patient is transported on an air ambulance with a team of medical professionals, including a physician, nurse, and paramedic.
* **Ground Ambulance with Medical Escort:** A patient is transported on a ground ambulance with a medical professional accompanying them to provide care and assistance.
* **Private Jet with Medical Team:** A patient is transported on a private jet with a team of medical professionals, including a physician, nurse, and paramedic.

**Factors Influencing the Choice of Option:**

* Patient's medical condition and stability
* Distance and duration of transport
* Availability of medical resources at the destination
* Patient's preferences and financial constraints
* Insurance coverage and reimbursement policies

items.text:
**Transport Options:**

* **Ground Ambulance:** A vehicle equipped with medical equipment and personnel to transport patients within a specific geographic area.
* **Air Ambulance:** A fixed-wing aircraft or helicopter equipped with medical equipment and personnel to transport patients over long distances or in emergency situations.
* **Commercial Airline:** A regular passenger airline that can accommodate patients with medical needs, such as oxygen therapy or stretcher transport.
* **Private Jet:** A chartered aircraft that can be customized to meet the specific medical needs of the patient.

**Medical Repatriation Options:**

* **Air Ambulance with Medical Team:** A patient is transported on an air ambulance with a team of medical professionals, including a physician, nurse, and paramedic.
* **Ground Ambulance with Medical Escort:** A patient is transported on a ground ambulance with a medical professional accompanying them to provide care and assistance.

llm_answer.text:
Based on the medical advice defined above, the doctor proposes the following options for transport or medical repatriation:

- Continuing treatment at the place of assistance or the initial care facility, with repatriation possibly being carried out later to the home or a hospital near the home.

- Transferring from the initial care facility to a local hospital better suited to your condition, with repatriation to a facility near the home or directly to the home being organized later. 

- Repatriating from the place of assistance or the initial care hospital to a facility near the home or directly to the home.

Depending on your medical condition, the repatriations or transfers are carried out with or without an escort (medical, paramedical or other) by one of the means deemed best suited:

- By ambulance, light medical vehicle (VSL) or taxi
- By scheduled airline, by train  
- By air ambulance
- Or any other type of medical or public transport
- By using your vehicle driven by a qualified driver that we send

 • Renseignements des informations concernant l’assuré
Aux fins de nous permettre de proposer à l’assuré le contrat et les options 
les plus adaptées, l’assuré doit renseigner un certain nombre d’informations.
Si l’assuré souscrit son contrat par téléphone auprès de l’un de 
nos conseillers, ses réponses sont recueillies préalablement à toute 
souscription. Lorsqu’une date et heure sont indiquées en bas d’un 
document (telles les Conditions Personnelles), par la signature électronique 
de ce document l’assuré reconnaît que ce document a bien été établi à la 
date et heure indiquées.
Si l’assuré souscrit son contrat en ligne sur Internet, il doit renseigner 
ces informations lui-même. A tout moment, l’assuré peut retourner sur 
l’écran de consultation précédent afin de corriger une information inexacte.

tion des prestations et prescriptions médicales, 
telles qu’elles sont proposées par nos médecins.
> Transport ou rapatriement sanitaire
En application du conseil médical ci-dessus 
défini, notre médecin propose :
 • la poursuite du traitement sur le lieu d’assistan -
ce ou de l’établissement de premiers soins, un

ment vers le domicile ou un établissement hos-

vers un centre hospitalier local mieux adapté à

étant organisé ultérieurement ;

ment au domicile.

Suivant votre état médical, les rapatriements 
ou transferts s’effectuent avec ou sans accom -
pagnateur (l’accompagnateur pouvant être 
médical, paramédical ou autre) par l’un des 
moyens paraissant le mieux adapté :

taxi ;
 •en avion de ligne régulière, en train  ;

public  ;

feur qualifié, que nous envoyons.

C’est le véhicule terrestre à moteur, n’excédant pas 3,5 tonnes de poids total en charge,  désigné aux 
conditions particulières. Il est nommé « véhicule » dans les présentes conditions générales.
Il s’agit du modèle livré par le constructeur, avec les options prévues au catalogue et montées avant sa 
1ère mise en circulation.
Votre véhicule est garanti pour l’usage défini dans vos conditions particulières. Il n’est pas garanti en cas de 
location et de transport de personnes ou de marchandises, à titre onéreux. 

 
 La question est What are the different options proposed by the medical team for transport or medical repatriation?

llm_answer.name: claude-3-opus-20240229

items.text:
Based on the medical advice defined above, the doctor proposes the following options for transport or medical repatriation:

- Continuing treatment at the place of assistance or the initial care facility, with repatriation possibly being carried out later to the home or a hospital near the home.

- Transferring from the initial care facility to a local hospital better suited to your condition, with repatriation to a facility near the home or directly to the home being organized later. 

- Repatriating from the place of assistance or the initial care hospital to a facility near the home or directly to the home.

Depending on your medical condition, the repatriations or transfers are carried out with or without an escort (medical, paramedical or other) by one of the means deemed best suited:

- By ambulance, light medical vehicle (VSL) or taxi
- By scheduled airline, by train  
- By air ambulance
- Or any other type of medical or public transport
- By using your vehicle driven by a qualified driver that we send

6018.  LA VIE DU CONTRA T
Événement Qui peut résilier ? Sur quelle base ?

Les conducteurs  
habituels doivent être désignés aux  conditions particulières . Les personnes, vivant en permanence sous le toit de la résidence  
principale du souscripteur et amenées à utiliser le véhicule, quelle qu’en soit la fréquence, son t toujours regardées comme des  
conducteurs habituels et doivent, à ce titre, être désignées aux  conditions particulières . 
 
Conducteur novice  
Personne qui a obtenu son permis de conduire depuis moins de 3 ans ou depuis 3 ans et plus mais qui ne peut justif ier de 3 années 
d’assurance.  
 
Conjoints  
Personnes vivant sous le même toit :  
 mariées  ;  
 unies par un pacte civil de solidarité  ; 
 communément considérées comme formant un couple.  
 
Consolidation  
Moment où les lésions se sont fixées et ont pris un caractè re permanent tel qu’un traitement n’est plus nécessaire, si ce n’est pour 
éviter une aggravation.

Ces traitements ont pour bases légales : l’intérêt légitime des responsables de traitement pour les finalités 
de prospection commerciale, de lutte contre la fraude à l’assurance, de recherche développement ainsi que 
d’actions de prévention ; et votre contrat pour les autres finalités citées, hors données de santé. Lorsque 
la base légale est le contrat, le refus de fournir vos données entraîne l’impossibilité de conclure celui-ci. 
Les responsables de traitement ont pour intérêt légitime : leur développement commercial, le développement 
de nouvelles offres et de nouveaux services, et la maîtrise de leur sinistralité.

Comment serez vous indemnisé en cas de déficit fonc tionnel permanent ?

- lutter contre la fraude à l’assurance ;-  mener des actions de lutte contre le blanchiment et le 
financement du  terrorisme ;
-  exécuter ses obligations légales, réglementaires et 
administratives en vigueur ;
-  effectuer des écoutes et enregistrements téléphoniques 
de manière non systématique, aux fins d’amélioration de la qualité de service, de formation et d’évaluation des 
collaborateurs.
 
 Ces traitements ont pour bases légales :  l’intérêt 
légitime des responsables de traitement pour les finalités de prospection commerciale de réalisation de sondage et enquête de satisfaction, de lutte contre la fraude à l’assurance, de recherche développement ainsi que d’actions de prévention ; et votre contrat pour les autres finalités citées hors données de santé. Lorsque la base légale est le contrat, le refus de fournir vos données entraîne l’impossibilité de conclure celui-ci.

llm_answer.text:
The coverage amount for permanent disability insurance is typically determined based on a percentage of your income, usually between 50% and 80%. The specific percentage will vary depending on the policy you choose and your individual circumstances.

For example, if you have a policy that provides 60% coverage and you earn $5,000 per month, your monthly benefit would be $3,000. This amount would be paid to you if you become permanently disabled and unable to work.

The level of permanent disability is typically defined as the inability to perform the duties of your own occupation or any other occupation for which you are reasonably suited by education, training, or experience. The definition of disability may vary from policy to policy, so it is important to read the policy carefully before you purchase it.

If you are considering purchasing permanent disability insurance, it is important to talk to an insurance agent to discuss your individual needs and to find a policy that provides the right coverage for you.

 La question est How is the coverage amount determined based on the level of permanent disability?

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text:
The coverage amount for permanent disability insurance is typically determined based on a percentage of your income, usually between 50% and 80%. The specific percentage will vary depending on the policy you choose and your individual circumstances.

For example, if you have a policy that provides 60% coverage and you earn $5,000 per month, your monthly benefit would be $3,000. This amount would be paid to you if you become permanently disabled and unable to work.

The level of permanent disability is typically defined as the inability to perform the duties of your own occupation or any other occupation for which you are reasonably suited by education, training, or experience. The definition of disability may vary from policy to policy, so it is important to read the policy carefully before you purchase it.

If you are considering purchasing permanent disability insurance, it is important to talk to an insurance agent to discuss your individual needs and to find a policy that provides the right coverage for you.

llm_answer.text:
Based on the information provided, here is how the coverage amount is determined based on the level of permanent functional deficit (déficit fonctionnel permanent or D.F.P.):

The indemnity amount is calculated by applying the percentage of permanent functional deficit to the coverage limit stated in the personal policy conditions (Conditions personnelles). 

Specifically, it states:

"Notre garantie s'exerce pour l'ensemble des préjudices dans la limite de la somme indiquée aux Conditions personnelles."

Which translates to:

"Our coverage applies for all losses within the limit of the amount indicated in the personal policy conditions."

So in summary:
1. The percentage of permanent functional deficit (D.F.P.) is determined 
2. This percentage is applied to the maximum coverage limit stated in the personal policy conditions
3. The resulting amount is the indemnity paid out for the permanent functional deficit

The text does not provide more specifics on the coverage limits or percentages used. Those key details would be found in the personal policy conditions for the insured individual.

  le coût de l’assistance d’une tierce personne après consolidation (A. T .P .) ;
  les souffrances endurées (S.E.) ;
  le préjudice esthétique permanent (P .E.P .) ;
  le préjudice d’agrément (P .A.).
En cas de décès :
  les pertes de revenus des ayants droit consécutives au décès du conducteur, que ce décès survienne immédiatement ou 
dans le délai d’un an des suites de l’ accident garanti (P .R.) ;
  le préjudice d’affection (P .A.F.) ;
  les frais d’obsèques (F.O.).
Comment serez-vous indemnisé en cas de déficit fonctionnel permanent ? 

 
 La question est How is the coverage amount determined based on the level of permanent disability?

llm_answer.name: claude-3-opus-20240229

items.text:
Based on the information provided, here is how the coverage amount is determined based on the level of permanent functional deficit (déficit fonctionnel permanent or D.F.P.):

The indemnity amount is calculated by applying the percentage of permanent functional deficit to the coverage limit stated in the personal policy conditions (Conditions personnelles). 

Specifically, it states:

"Notre garantie s'exerce pour l'ensemble des préjudices dans la limite de la somme indiquée aux Conditions personnelles."

Which translates to:

"Our coverage applies for all losses within the limit of the amount indicated in the personal policy conditions."

So in summary:
1. The percentage of permanent functional deficit (D.F.P.) is determined 
2. This percentage is applied to the maximum coverage limit stated in the personal policy conditions
3. The resulting amount is the indemnity paid out for the permanent functional deficit

The text does not provide more specifics on the coverage limits or percentages used. Those key details would be found in the personal policy conditions for the insured individual.

 La question est How are the names and addresses of the members present or represented recorded during a general assembly?

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text: The names and addresses of the members present or represented during a general assembly are typically recorded in the minutes of the meeting. The minutes are a written record of the proceedings of the meeting, and they include information such as the date, time, and location of the meeting, the names of the members present or represented, the agenda items discussed, and any decisions made. The minutes are typically prepared by the secretary of the organization, and they are distributed to the members after the meeting.

llm_answer.text:
During a general assembly or annual general meeting of a company or organization, the names and addresses of members present or represented are typically recorded in the following ways:

1. Attendance sheet or sign-in sheet: As members arrive, they sign an attendance sheet that captures their name, address, and whether they are attending in person or by proxy/representative. This provides a record of who was present.

2. Minutes: The official minutes of the meeting will list the names of members in attendance and those represented by proxy. The addresses are often on file already rather than repeated in the minutes. 

3. Proxy forms: When a member is being represented by another person via proxy, there is usually a proxy form that designates the representative and is signed by the member granting proxy rights. This form would have the member's name and address.

4. Registration: For larger meetings, there may be a registration process or check-in where members' attendance is recorded electronically or by staff when they arrive. The registration database would contain names and addresses.

5. Voting records: If any votes or actions are taken at the meeting, the ballots or electronic voting records would indicate which members voted, linking to their identifying information.

So in summary, the sign-in process, proxy forms, registration lists, minutes and voting records work together to document the identities and addresses of those present or represented at a general assembly. The organization maintains this information as part of the official records of the meeting.

4. Registration: For larger meetings, there may be a registration process or check-in where members' attendance is recorded electronically or by staff when they arrive. The registration database would contain names and addresses.

So in summary, the sign-in process, proxy forms, registration lists, minutes and voting records work together to document the identities and addresses of those present or represented at a general assembly. The organization maintains this information as part of the official records of the meeting.

question.text: What is the maximum limit beyond which the policyholder cannot be held responsible for additional charges, except for increases in fiscal and similar burdens?

items.text:
Le permis BE est nécessaire pour la conduite des 
véhicules de catégorie B attelés d’une caravane ou 
d’une remorque ou semi-remorque lorsque  :
 • le poids total autorisé en charge (PTAC) de la re -
morque ou de la caravane est supérieur à 750 kg 
et inférieur à 3 500 kg
 • et que la somme des PTAC du véhicule tracteur et 
de la remorque ou de la caravane est supérieure 
à 4 250 kg.
Les droits acquis des détenteurs d’un permis de la 
catégorie EB obtenu avant le 19 janvier 2013 sont 
maintenus par l’apposition de la mention addition -
nelle 79.06 spécifique (permettant de tracter une 
remorque ou une caravane d’un PTAC supérieur à 
3 500kg) en cas de renouvellement du titre.

40-4 VARIABILITÉ  
La Matmut est une Société d’assurance mutuelle à cotisations variables.  
Si les cotisations annuelles sont insuffisantes pour assurer l’équilibre des opérations, le Conseil d’Administration peut décider  de 
procéder à un rappel de cotisation au titre de l’exercice considéré.  
Vous ne pouvez en aucun cas être tenu, sauf en ce qui concerne l’augmentation des charges fiscales, parafiscales et assimilées,  au-
delà d’un maximum fixé à deux fois le montant de la cotisation annuelle appelée.

Foyer de l’assuré
Ce sont les personnes vivant habituellement sous son toit, et ses enfants financièrement ou fiscalement à charge.
Frais de gardiennage 
Ce sont tous les frais qui sont liés à une voiture déclarée économiquement irréparable (remorquage, gardiennage...).
Frais de prévention 
Frais exposés par des tiers pour prévenir la réalisation imminente d’un préjudice écologique, pour éviter son aggravation 
ou pour en réduire les conséquences. Les coûts des mesures raisonnables propres à prévenir ou faire cesser le préjudice 
écologique que le juge peut prescrire quand il est saisi d’une demande en ce sens par toute personne ayant qualité et intérêt 
à agir.
Frais proportionnels
Somme qui a vocation à couvrir l’ensemble des travaux et diligences effectués par l’huissier de justice, ainsi que les frais 
supportés par ce dernier à l’exception des frais de déplacement, de débours et des travaux rémunérés par des honoraires 
libres.

Bénéficiaire(s)
Le souscripteur, son conjoint, son partenaire ou concubin, ses ascendants 
et ses descendants fiscalement à charge et vivant sous le même toit.
De plus, excepté le cas de location du véhicule assuré, le conducteur 
ainsi que toute personne transportée voyageant à titre gratuit bénéficient de 
l’assistance au véhicule, selon les garanties prévues au contrat.
Déplacement / Voyage
Déplacement ou séjour d’une durée égale ou inférieure à 90 jours 
consécutifs.
Domicile
Lieu de résidence principal et habituel du bénéficiaire situé en France 
Métropolitaine.

Structure adaptée à chaque cas particulier et définie par notre médecin 
régulateur.

location et de transport de personnes ou de marchandises, à titre onéreux.
VOUS TRACTEZ UNE CARAVANE OU UNE REMORQUE
Si vous tractez une remorque, une caravane (ou un autre appareil terrestre), d’un poids total autorisé en charge 
maximum de 750 kg, ces appareils attelés sont garantis en RESPONSABILITÉ CIVILE et DÉFENSE PÉNALE 
ET RECOURS SUITE À ACCIDENT, sans qu’il soit nécessaire de les désigner aux conditions particulières.
Les prestations d’assistance, accordées au véhicule, sont également étendues à ces appareils attelés, à 
l’exception de la prestation véhicule de remplacement.
La garantie RESPONSABILITÉ CIVILE est aussi accordée à cette remorque ou caravane lorsqu’elle est dételée 
et impliquée dans un accident de la circulation.

question.text: What is the role of the board of directors in determining the remuneration of the director general?

items.text:
Automobile
180209 BConditions  
générales  
Auto RéférenceRéf. 180209 B 02 2021-

Le contrat est constitué par :
n  les présentes Conditions générales qui définissent les biens, les événements et les risques assurables et les 
exclusions générales, et qui précisent nos droits et obligations réciproques ;
n les Conditions particulières qui adaptent et complètent les Conditions générales, à votre situation personnelle ;
n  le questionnaire de déclaration du risque préalable à la souscription de votre contrat d’assurance automobile, signé 
par vous ;
n  les avenants éventuels qui modifient le contrat.
En cas de contradiction, les Conditions particulières prévalent sur les Conditions générales.

llm_answer.text:
**Role of the Board of Directors in Determining Director General Remuneration**

The board of directors plays a crucial role in determining the remuneration of the director general (DG). This responsibility is typically carried out through the following steps:

**1. Establishing Remuneration Policy:**

* The board develops a remuneration policy that outlines the principles and guidelines for determining the DG's compensation.
* This policy considers factors such as the organization's size, industry, performance, and market benchmarks.

**2. Setting Remuneration Structure:**

* The board determines the components of the DG's remuneration package, which may include:
    * Base salary
    * Performance-based bonuses
    * Long-term incentives (e.g., stock options, restricted stock units)
    * Benefits and perks

**3. Evaluating Performance:**

* The board regularly evaluates the DG's performance against agreed-upon targets and objectives.
* This evaluation forms the basis for determining the variable components of the remuneration package.

**4. Benchmarking and Market Analysis:**

* The board conducts market research to compare the DG's remuneration with similar positions in the industry and region.
* This ensures that the compensation is competitive and aligns with market norms.

**5. Approving Remuneration:**

* The board formally approves the DG's remuneration package after considering the policy, performance evaluation, and market analysis.
* This approval is typically documented in a resolution or contract.

**6. Disclosure and Transparency:**

* The board ensures that the DG's remuneration is disclosed in accordance with applicable regulations and best practices.
* This transparency promotes accountability and stakeholder confidence.

**7. Monitoring and Review:**

* The board regularly monitors the effectiveness of the remuneration policy and makes adjustments as necessary.
* This ensures that the DG's compensation remains aligned with the organization's goals and performance.

**Key Considerations:**

* The board's decisions should be based on objective criteria and avoid conflicts of interest.
* The remuneration package should incentivize the DG to achieve the organization's strategic objectives.
* The board should consider the impact of the DG's remuneration on employee morale and stakeholder perceptions.

llm_answer.text:
I apologize, but the document you provided appears to be an insurance policy written in French. It does not contain any information about the role of a board of directors in determining the remuneration of a director general.

In general though, the board of directors does typically have a key role in setting the compensation for the CEO (directeur général). Some of their main responsibilities related to CEO pay include:

- Establishing the overall compensation philosophy and structure for senior executives
- Benchmarking CEO pay against peer companies and market data  
- Setting specific salary, bonus, long-term incentive and benefits targets for the CEO
- Evaluating CEO performance and determining actual payouts based on achievement of goals
- Ensuring CEO pay aligns with shareholder interests and company strategy

The board often has a dedicated compensation committee comprised of independent directors that leads this process and makes recommendations to the full board for approval. However, the specific details can vary by company and jurisdiction. Let me know if you need any clarification or have additional questions!

 Intérieur du véhicule

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text:
* Transportation and lodging for the injured individual's family members

* Medical expenses for the injured individual's family members
* Lost wages for the injured individual's family members
* Other expenses as deemed necessary by the repatriation provider

llm_answer.text:
Based on the information provided in the insurance policy excerpts, if a person is waiting for the repatriation of an injured individual who cannot be transported, the policy covers the following expenses for the waiting person:

- Hotel accommodation expenses up to €80 per night, for a maximum of 10 nights.

Specifically, the policy states:

"If the Insured Person is hospitalized and their state of health does not justify or prevents immediate repatriation or return, we organize and cover the hotel accommodation expenses (room and breakfast) of a Beneficiary who remains at their bedside up to €80 per night, for a maximum of 10 nights."

So in summary, the waiting person's hotel and breakfast expenses are covered up to €80 per night for a maximum of 10 nights while they wait for the injured person to be able to be repatriated.

Based on the information provided in the insurance policy excerpts, if a person is waiting for the repatriation of an injured individual who cannot be transported, the policy covers the following expenses for the waiting person:

- Hotel accommodation expenses up to €80 per night, for a maximum of 10 nights.

Specifically, the policy states:

"If the Insured Person is hospitalized and their state of health does not justify or prevents immediate repatriation or return, we organize and cover the hotel accommodation expenses (room and breakfast) of a Beneficiary who remains at their bedside up to €80 per night, for a maximum of 10 nights."

So in summary, the waiting person's hotel and breakfast expenses are covered up to €80 per night for a maximum of 10 nights while they wait for the injured person to be able to be repatriated.

ARTICLE 15  DÉCLARATION DU RISQUE  
À LA SOUSCRIPTION
Le souscripteur doit, lors de la souscription du contrat, répondre exactement 
aux questions que nous lui posons.
Ces réponses sont reprises sur les Conditions Person  nelles et 
constituent la base de notre acceptation du risque et de notre 
tarification.
ARTICLE 16  DÉCLARATION EN COURS DE CONTRAT
En cours de contrat, le souscripteur doit nous déclarer par téléphone 
ou par lettre recommandée toute modification apportée à l’un des 
éléments figurant sur les Conditions Personnelles ainsi que le retrait 
de la carte grise par mesure conservatoire justifiée par l’état du véhicule.

llm_answer.text:
**Ensuring Compliance with Data Protection Regulations in Handling Beneficiary Personal Information**

**1. Data Collection and Storage:**

* Obtain explicit consent from beneficiaries before collecting and storing their personal information.
* Implement secure data storage systems that comply with industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001).
* Limit access to personal information to authorized personnel only.

**2. Data Processing:**

* Use personal information only for the purposes specified in the assistance contract.
* Implement data minimization practices, only collecting and processing the information necessary for the contract.
* Ensure that data processing is transparent and accountable.

**3. Data Sharing:**

* Obtain consent from beneficiaries before sharing their personal information with third parties.
* Establish clear data sharing agreements with third parties, outlining the purpose and scope of sharing.
* Implement data transfer mechanisms that comply with applicable regulations (e.g., GDPR).

**4. Data Security:**

* Implement robust cybersecurity measures to protect personal information from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.
* Conduct regular security audits and vulnerability assessments.
* Train employees on data security best practices.

**5. Data Retention:**

* Establish clear data retention policies that specify the period for which personal information will be stored.
* Securely dispose of personal information when it is no longer required.

**6. Data Subject Rights:**

* Inform beneficiaries of their rights under data protection regulations, including the right to access, rectify, erase, and restrict processing of their personal information.
* Establish clear procedures for handling data subject requests.

**7. Compliance Monitoring:**

* Regularly review and update data protection policies and procedures.
* Conduct internal audits to ensure compliance with regulations.
* Seek external certifications or accreditations to demonstrate compliance (e.g., ISO 27018).

**8. Training and Awareness:**

* Provide training to employees on data protection regulations and best practices.
* Foster a culture of data privacy awareness within the organization.

**9. Incident Response:**

* Establish a clear incident response plan for data breaches or security incidents.
* Notify beneficiaries and relevant authorities promptly in the event of a data breach.

**10. Continuous Improvement:**

* Regularly review and improve data protection practices to ensure ongoing compliance with regulations.
* Seek feedback from beneficiaries and stakeholders to identify areas for improvement.

 La question est How does the insurer ensure compliance with data protection regulations in handling the personal information of the beneficiaries for the assistance contract?

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text:
**Ensuring Compliance with Data Protection Regulations in Handling Beneficiary Personal Information**

**1. Data Collection and Storage:**

* Obtain explicit consent from beneficiaries before collecting and storing their personal information.
* Implement secure data storage systems that comply with industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001).
* Limit access to personal information to authorized personnel only.

**2. Data Processing:**

* Use personal information only for the purposes specified in the assistance contract.
* Implement data minimization practices, only collecting and processing the information necessary for the contract.
* Ensure that data processing is transparent and accountable.

**3. Data Sharing:**

* Obtain consent from beneficiaries before sharing their personal information with third parties.
* Establish clear data sharing agreements with third parties, outlining the purpose and scope of sharing.
* Implement data transfer mechanisms that comply with applicable regulations (e.g., GDPR).

**4. Data Security:**

* Implement robust cybersecurity measures to protect personal information from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.
* Conduct regular security audits and vulnerability assessments.
* Train employees on data security best practices.

**5. Data Retention:**

* Establish clear data retention policies that specify the period for which personal information will be stored.
* Securely dispose of personal information when it is no longer required.

**6. Data Subject Rights:**

* Inform beneficiaries of their rights under data protection regulations, including the right to access, rectify, erase, and restrict processing of their personal information.
* Establish clear procedures for handling data subject requests.

**7. Compliance Monitoring:**

* Regularly review and update data protection policies and procedures.
* Conduct internal audits to ensure compliance with regulations.
* Seek external certifications or accreditations to demonstrate compliance (e.g., ISO 27018).

**8. Training and Awareness:**

* Provide training to employees on data protection regulations and best practices.
* Foster a culture of data privacy awareness within the organization.

**9. Incident Response:**

* Establish a clear incident response plan for data breaches or security incidents.
* Notify beneficiaries and relevant authorities promptly in the event of a data breach.

**10. Continuous Improvement:**

* Regularly review and improve data protection practices to ensure ongoing compliance with regulations.
* Seek feedback from beneficiaries and stakeholders to identify areas for improvement.

llm_answer.text:
Based on the information provided in the contract terms, the insurer (AXA Assistance) takes the following measures to ensure compliance with data protection regulations when handling the personal information of assistance beneficiaries:

1. If the beneficiary provides AXA Assistance with information about third parties, the insured agrees to inform those third parties about the use of their data as defined in the contract terms and in AXA Assistance's online privacy policy. 

2. The insured can obtain, upon simple request, a copy of the information concerning them that is held by AXA Assistance. 

3. The insured has a right to information on how their data is used (as indicated in AXA Assistance's online privacy policy) and a right of rectification if they notice an error.

4. If the insured wants to know what information is held about them by AXA Assistance, or if they have other requests concerning the use of their data, they can write to:

Data Protection Officer
AXA Assistance 
6, rue André Gide
92320 Châtillon
E-mail : dpo.axapartnersfrance@axa-assistance.com

5. AXA Assistance's full privacy policy is available on their website axa-assistance.fr or in paper format upon request.

In summary, the key measures are informing third parties, providing access and rectification rights to insureds, having a Data Protection Officer to handle requests, and making the full privacy policy available. This demonstrates AXA Assistance's efforts to comply with data protection regulations.

 La question est How does the insurer ensure compliance with data protection regulations in handling the personal information of the beneficiaries for the assistance contract?

llm_answer.name: claude-3-opus-20240229

items.text:
Based on the information provided in the contract terms, the insurer (AXA Assistance) takes the following measures to ensure compliance with data protection regulations when handling the personal information of assistance beneficiaries:

1. If the beneficiary provides AXA Assistance with information about third parties, the insured agrees to inform those third parties about the use of their data as defined in the contract terms and in AXA Assistance's online privacy policy. 

2. The insured can obtain, upon simple request, a copy of the information concerning them that is held by AXA Assistance. 

3. The insured has a right to information on how their data is used (as indicated in AXA Assistance's online privacy policy) and a right of rectification if they notice an error.

4. If the insured wants to know what information is held about them by AXA Assistance, or if they have other requests concerning the use of their data, they can write to:

Data Protection Officer
AXA Assistance 
6, rue André Gide
92320 Châtillon
E-mail : dpo.axapartnersfrance@axa-assistance.com

5. AXA Assistance's full privacy policy is available on their website axa-assistance.fr or in paper format upon request.

In summary, the key measures are informing third parties, providing access and rectification rights to insureds, having a Data Protection Officer to handle requests, and making the full privacy policy available. This demonstrates AXA Assistance's efforts to comply with data protection regulations.

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text: No

llm_answer.text:
Yes, based on the information provided in the summary, the "Garantie Dommages tous accidents" covers damages resulting from climatic events:

"La protection du véhicule
- Bris de glaces  . p 15
- Catastrophes naturelles  . p 15
- Vol . p 15
- Incendie  . p 17
- Dommages tous accidents  . p 17"

And more explicitly in the list of what is covered:

"• La tempête et les événements climatiques exceptionnels
• Les dommages tous accidents"

So exceptional climatic events and storms are listed as being covered under the comprehensive "Dommages tous accidents" coverage.

 La question est Are damages resulting from climatic events covered under the "Garantie Dommages tous accidents"?

llm_answer.name: claude-3-opus-20240229

items.text:
Yes, based on the information provided in the summary, the "Garantie Dommages tous accidents" covers damages resulting from climatic events:

"La protection du véhicule
- Bris de glaces  . p 15
- Catastrophes naturelles  . p 15
- Vol . p 15
- Incendie  . p 17
- Dommages tous accidents  . p 17"

And more explicitly in the list of what is covered:

"• La tempête et les événements climatiques exceptionnels
• Les dommages tous accidents"

So exceptional climatic events and storms are listed as being covered under the comprehensive "Dommages tous accidents" coverage.

    Les freins : groupe hydraulique ABS, câble de frein à main, 
cylindres de roue, étriers de freins, maître cylindre, pompe d’assistance, boîtier d’aide au freinage d’urgence.
    La suspension :  axes de pivots et bagues, axes, barres 
stabilisatrices, bras de suspension supérieurs et inférieurs, ressorts, rotules, électrovanne, suspension hydraulique et pneumatique, à l’exception des amortisseurs .
  L’alimentation :  pompe à carburant, pompe d’injection, 
turbocompresseur, distributeur, débitmètre d’air, injecteurs.

La transmission :  tous les organes et pièces internes, y 
compris les arbres, boîte de transfert et du réducteur 4x4, les roulements de roue/moyeux et les joints spi.
    La direction : crémaillère, colonne de direction, système 
de commande électrique et hydraulique, à  l’exception du 
contrôle et réglage du train avant.
    Les freins : groupe hydraulique ABS, câble de frein à main, 
cylindres de roue, étriers de freins, maître cylindre, pompe d’assistance, boîtier d’aide au freinage d’urgence.
    La suspension :  axes de pivots et bagues, axes, barres 
stabilisatrices, bras de suspension supérieurs et inférieurs, ressorts, rotules, électrovanne, suspension hydraulique et pneumatique, à l’exception des amortisseurs .

 La question est What components are covered under the warranty for the Crémaillère, vérins de direction, and pompe d’assistance in the document?

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text: The provided document does not specify the components covered under the warranty for the Crémaillère, vérins de direction, and pompe d’assistance.

llm_answer.text:
According to the document, for the steering system (direction), the following components are covered under the warranty:

Crémaillère (rack), vérins de direction (steering cylinders), pompe d'assistance (power steering pump), except for the conduits et durits (hoses and lines).

So the rack, steering cylinders and power steering pump itself are covered, but the associated hoses and lines are excluded from the warranty coverage.

 La question est What components are covered under the warranty for the Crémaillère, vérins de direction, and pompe d’assistance in the document?

llm_answer.name: claude-3-opus-20240229

items.text:
According to the document, for the steering system (direction), the following components are covered under the warranty:

Crémaillère (rack), vérins de direction (steering cylinders), pompe d'assistance (power steering pump), except for the conduits et durits (hoses and lines).

So the rack, steering cylinders and power steering pump itself are covered, but the associated hoses and lines are excluded from the warranty coverage.

l’une des parties n’aurait pas contracté ou aurait contracté à des conditions substantiellement différentes.

Franchise
Nonobstant toute disposition contraire, l’assuré conserve à sa charge une partie de l’indemnité due après sinistre. Il 
s’interdit de contracter une assurance pour la portion du risque constituée par la franchise.
Pour les véhicules terrestres à moteur, quel que soit leur usage, le montant de la franchise est de 380 € pour chaque 
véhicule endommagé. Toutefois, pour les véhicules terrestres à moteur à usage professionnel, sera appliquée la franchise 
prévue par le contrat, si celle-ci est supérieure.
Obligation de l’assuré
L’assuré doit déclarer à l’assureur ou à son représentant local tout sinistre susceptible de faire jouer la garantie dès qu’il

catastrophe naturelle.

en a connaissance et au plus tard dans les 10 jours suivant la publication de l’arrêté interministériel constatant l’état de 
catastrophe naturelle.
Quand plusieurs assurances contractées par l’assuré peuvent permettre la réparation des dommages matériels directs 
non assurables résultant de l’intensité anormale d’un agent naturel, l’assuré doit, en cas de sinistre et dans le délai 
mentionné au précédent alinéa, déclarer l’existence de ces assurances aux assureurs intéressés.

llm_answer.text:
**Actions the Insurer Can Take if the Policyholder Fails to Fulfill Obligations:**

**1. Notice and Opportunity to Cure:**

* The insurer may provide written notice to the policyholder, specifying the obligations that have not been fulfilled.
* The notice should provide a reasonable time frame for the policyholder to rectify the situation.

**2. Suspension of Coverage:**

* If the policyholder fails to cure the breach within the specified time frame, the insurer may suspend coverage.
* This means that the policy will not provide any benefits until the breach is resolved.

**3. Cancellation of Policy:**

* If the breach is material or the policyholder fails to cure it within a reasonable time, the insurer may cancel the policy.
* Cancellation terminates the policy and all coverage provided under it.

**4. Denial of Claims:**

* The insurer may deny any claims made under the policy if the policyholder has breached their obligations.
* This includes claims for losses that occurred during the period of suspension or after cancellation.

**5. Legal Action:**

* In some cases, the insurer may pursue legal action against the policyholder to enforce the terms of the contract.
* This could include filing a lawsuit for breach of contract or seeking an injunction to prevent the policyholder from violating the contract.

**6. Other Remedies:**

* Depending on the specific terms of the policy and the nature of the breach, the insurer may have other remedies available, such as:
    * Reducing the coverage limits
    * Increasing the premiums
    * Imposing additional conditions on the policy

 La question est What actions can the insurer take if the policyholder fails to fulfill their obligations under the contract?

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text:
**Actions the Insurer Can Take if the Policyholder Fails to Fulfill Obligations:**

**1. Notice and Opportunity to Cure:**

* The insurer may provide written notice to the policyholder, specifying the obligations that have not been fulfilled.
* The notice should provide a reasonable time frame for the policyholder to rectify the situation.

**2. Suspension of Coverage:**

* If the policyholder fails to cure the breach within the specified time frame, the insurer may suspend coverage.
* This means that the policy will not provide any benefits until the breach is resolved.

**3. Cancellation of Policy:**

* If the breach is material or the policyholder fails to cure it within a reasonable time, the insurer may cancel the policy.
* Cancellation terminates the policy and all coverage provided under it.

**4. Denial of Claims:**

* The insurer may deny any claims made under the policy if the policyholder has breached their obligations.
* This includes claims for losses that occurred during the period of suspension or after cancellation.

**5. Legal Action:**

* In some cases, the insurer may pursue legal action against the policyholder to enforce the terms of the contract.
* This could include filing a lawsuit for breach of contract or seeking an injunction to prevent the policyholder from violating the contract.

**6. Other Remedies:**

* Depending on the specific terms of the policy and the nature of the breach, the insurer may have other remedies available, such as:
    * Reducing the coverage limits
    * Increasing the premiums
    * Imposing additional conditions on the policy

llm_answer.text:
Based on the excerpts provided, if the policyholder fails to fulfill their obligations under the insurance contract, the insurer can take the following actions:

1. Nullify the contract (nullité du contrat) if:
- The policyholder made a false voluntary declaration about the risk, either when taking out the policy or during the course of the contract, with the intention of deceiving the insurer. This constitutes a breach of the obligation to contract in good faith. The contract can be nullified even if the false declaration had no impact on the claim.
- There were defects of consent (error, fraud or violence) of such a nature that, without them, one of the parties would not have entered into the contract or would have done so under substantially different conditions. 

When the contract is nullified, it is considered to have never existed.

2. Apply a deductible/excess (franchise):
- Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, the policyholder remains responsible for a portion of the compensation due after a claim. They are prohibited from taking out insurance for the portion of the risk constituted by the deductible.
- For motor vehicles, regardless of their use, the amount of the deductible is €380 for each damaged vehicle. However, for motor vehicles for professional use, the deductible provided for in the contract will be applied if it is higher.

So in summary, the main actions available to the insurer are nullifying the contract in cases of false declarations or defects of consent, and applying the contractual deductibles when claims are made. The excerpts don't mention other specific actions the insurer can take when the policyholder fails to meet their obligations.

 vices du consentement (erreur, dol ou violence - articles 1130  à 1144 du Code civil ) lorsqu’ils sont de telle nature que, sans eux, 
l’une des parties n’aurait pas contracté ou aurait contracté à des conditions substantiellement différentes. 

 Franchise
Nonobstant toute disposition contraire, l’assuré conserve à sa charge une partie de l’indemnité due après sinistre. Il 
s’interdit de contracter une assurance pour la portion du risque constituée par la franchise.
Pour les véhicules terrestres à moteur, quel que soit leur usage, le montant de la franchise est de 380 € pour chaque 
véhicule endommagé. Toutefois, pour les véhicules terrestres à moteur à usage professionnel, sera appliquée la franchise 
prévue par le contrat, si celle-ci est supérieure.
Obligation de l’assuré
L’assuré doit déclarer à l’assureur ou à son représentant local tout sinistre susceptible de faire jouer la garantie dès qu’il 
en a connaissance et au plus tard dans les 10 jours suivant la publication de l’arrêté interministériel constatant l’état de 
catastrophe naturelle.

 La question est What actions can the insurer take if the policyholder fails to fulfill their obligations under the contract?

llm_answer.name: claude-3-opus-20240229

items.text:
Based on the excerpts provided, if the policyholder fails to fulfill their obligations under the insurance contract, the insurer can take the following actions:

1. Nullify the contract (nullité du contrat) if:
- The policyholder made a false voluntary declaration about the risk, either when taking out the policy or during the course of the contract, with the intention of deceiving the insurer. This constitutes a breach of the obligation to contract in good faith. The contract can be nullified even if the false declaration had no impact on the claim.
- There were defects of consent (error, fraud or violence) of such a nature that, without them, one of the parties would not have entered into the contract or would have done so under substantially different conditions. 

When the contract is nullified, it is considered to have never existed.

2. Apply a deductible/excess (franchise):
- Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, the policyholder remains responsible for a portion of the compensation due after a claim. They are prohibited from taking out insurance for the portion of the risk constituted by the deductible.
- For motor vehicles, regardless of their use, the amount of the deductible is €380 for each damaged vehicle. However, for motor vehicles for professional use, the deductible provided for in the contract will be applied if it is higher.

So in summary, the main actions available to the insurer are nullifying the contract in cases of false declarations or defects of consent, and applying the contractual deductibles when claims are made. The excerpts don't mention other specific actions the insurer can take when the policyholder fails to meet their obligations.

llm_answer.text:
**Consequences of Not Respecting Claim Reporting Deadlines:**

**1. Loss of Coverage:**

* Failure to report a claim within the specified time frame may result in the insurer denying coverage for the claim.
* The policy may state that the insured has a duty to report claims promptly, and failure to do so may be considered a breach of contract.

**2. Reduced Benefits:**

* Even if the insurer does not deny coverage, they may reduce the amount of benefits payable if the claim is reported late.
* This is because the insurer may have difficulty investigating the claim and determining the extent of the loss if it is reported late.

**3. Increased Premiums:**

* Insurers may increase premiums for policyholders who have a history of late claim reporting.
* This is because late reporting can increase the insurer's risk and administrative costs.

**4. Legal Consequences:**

* In some cases, failure to report a claim within the specified time frame may be considered a violation of the law.
* This can result in fines or other penalties.

**5. Loss of Evidence:**

* Delaying the reporting of a claim can result in the loss of valuable evidence.
* This can make it more difficult for the insurer to investigate the claim and determine the extent of the loss.

**6. Difficulty in Obtaining Legal Representation:**

* Attorneys may be less willing to represent policyholders who have failed to report claims promptly.
* This is because late reporting can make it more difficult to build a strong case.

**7. Loss of Credibility:**

* Policyholders who fail to report claims promptly may lose credibility with their insurer.
* This can make it more difficult to obtain coverage or favorable terms in the future.

**8. Emotional Distress:**

* Not reporting a claim promptly can cause emotional distress for the policyholder.
* They may feel anxious, frustrated, or overwhelmed by the situation.

 La question est What are the consequences of not respecting the deadlines for reporting a claim?

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text:
**Consequences of Not Respecting Claim Reporting Deadlines:**

**1. Loss of Coverage:**

* Failure to report a claim within the specified time frame may result in the insurer denying coverage for the claim.
* The policy may state that the insured has a duty to report claims promptly, and failure to do so may be considered a breach of contract.

**2. Reduced Benefits:**

* Even if the insurer does not deny coverage, they may reduce the amount of benefits payable if the claim is reported late.
* This is because the insurer may have difficulty investigating the claim and determining the extent of the loss if it is reported late.

**3. Increased Premiums:**

* Insurers may increase premiums for policyholders who have a history of late claim reporting.
* This is because late reporting can increase the insurer's risk and administrative costs.

**4. Legal Consequences:**

* In some cases, failure to report a claim within the specified time frame may be considered a violation of the law.
* This can result in fines or other penalties.

**5. Loss of Evidence:**

* Delaying the reporting of a claim can result in the loss of valuable evidence.
* This can make it more difficult for the insurer to investigate the claim and determine the extent of the loss.

**6. Difficulty in Obtaining Legal Representation:**

* Attorneys may be less willing to represent policyholders who have failed to report claims promptly.
* This is because late reporting can make it more difficult to build a strong case.

**7. Loss of Credibility:**

* Policyholders who fail to report claims promptly may lose credibility with their insurer.
* This can make it more difficult to obtain coverage or favorable terms in the future.

**8. Emotional Distress:**

* Not reporting a claim promptly can cause emotional distress for the policyholder.
* They may feel anxious, frustrated, or overwhelmed by the situation.

llm_answer.text:
Based on the information provided in the insurance policy excerpts, if you do not respect the deadlines for reporting a claim:

1. The compensation owed could be reduced in proportion to the premium paid compared to the premium that would have been due, if a claim occurred after the transfer of ownership of the vehicle and before the insurer was made aware of it. 

2. More generally, not following the proper procedure and deadlines outlined for reporting claims could jeopardize your interests and make it more difficult to receive compensation. The policy recommends respecting the steps indicated in order to preserve the common interests of the insured and insurer and facilitate the claims process.

3. While not explicitly stated, late reporting of claims beyond required deadlines could potentially allow the insurer to deny coverage in some cases, arguing the delay prejudiced their ability to properly investigate and handle the claim.

So in summary, to protect your rights to full compensation, it's important to notify claims to the insurer within the timeframes specified in the policy terms and conditions. Delays or failure to do so could lead to reduced payouts or even denial of coverage.

 La question est What are the consequences of not respecting the deadlines for reporting a claim?

llm_answer.name: claude-3-opus-20240229

items.text:
Based on the information provided in the insurance policy excerpts, if you do not respect the deadlines for reporting a claim:

1. The compensation owed could be reduced in proportion to the premium paid compared to the premium that would have been due, if a claim occurred after the transfer of ownership of the vehicle and before the insurer was made aware of it. 

2. More generally, not following the proper procedure and deadlines outlined for reporting claims could jeopardize your interests and make it more difficult to receive compensation. The policy recommends respecting the steps indicated in order to preserve the common interests of the insured and insurer and facilitate the claims process.

3. While not explicitly stated, late reporting of claims beyond required deadlines could potentially allow the insurer to deny coverage in some cases, arguing the delay prejudiced their ability to properly investigate and handle the claim.

So in summary, to protect your rights to full compensation, it's important to notify claims to the insurer within the timeframes specified in the policy terms and conditions. Delays or failure to do so could lead to reduced payouts or even denial of coverage.

question.text: How is the prescription period interrupted by a conservatory measure or forced execution act?

items.text:
Quand l’action de l’assuré contre l’assureur a pour cause le recours d’un 
tiers, le délai de prescription ne court que du jour où ce tiers a exercé une 
action en justice contre l’assuré ou a été indemnisé par ce dernier.
La prescription est portée à dix ans dans les contrats d’assurance contre 
les accidents atteignant les personnes, lorsque les bénéficiaires sont les 
ayants-droit de l’assuré décédé.
Conformément à l’article L114-2 du Code des assurances, la prescription est 
interrompue par une des causes ordinaires d’interruption de la prescription 
visée ci-après :
• toute demande en justice, même en référé, ou même portée devant une 
juridiction incompétente ;
• tout acte d’exécution forcée, ou toute mesure conservatoire prise en 
application du code des procédures civiles d’exécution ;
• toute reconnaissance par l’assureur du droit à garantie de l’assuré, ou 
toute reconnaissance de dette de l’assuré envers l’assureur ; 
• tout recours à la médiation ou à la conciliation lorsque la partie est dans 
l’impossibilité d’agir par suite d’un empêchement résultant de la loi, de la 
convention d’assistance ou de la Force Majeure.

65Causes ordinaires d'interruption de la prescription
Article 2240 du code civil
La reconnaissance par le débiteur du droit de celui contre lequel il prescrivait interrompt le délai de prescription.
Article 2241 du code civil
La demande en justice, même en référé, interrompt le délai de prescription ainsi que le délai de forclusion. Il en est de même lorsqu’elle est portée devant une juridiction incompétente ou lorsque l’acte de saisine de la juridiction est annulé par l’effet d’un vice de procédure.
Article 2242 du code civil
L’interruption résultant de la demande en justice produit ses effets jusqu’à l’extinction de l’instance.

Article 2241 du code civil
La demande en justice, même en référé, interrompt le délai de prescription ainsi que le délai de forclusion. Il en est de même lorsqu’elle est portée devant une juridiction incompétente ou lorsque l’acte de saisine de la juridiction est annulé par l’effet d’un vice de procédure.
Article 2242 du code civil
L’interruption résultant de la demande en justice produit ses effets jusqu’à l’extinction de l’instance.
Article 2243 du code civil
L’interruption est non avenue si le demandeur se désiste de sa demande ou laisse périmer l’instance, ou si sa demande est définitivement rejetée.

Passé ce délai, il y a prescription : toute action dérivant 
du contrat d’assurance est éteinte.
Le délai de prescription est interrompu :
-  soit par l’envoi d’une lettre recommandée avec accusé de réception adressée par MMA à votre dernier 
domicile connu en ce qui concerne le paiement de la cotisation, ou par l’envoi d’un recommandé adressé 
par vos soins à MMA en ce qui concerne le règlement d’un sinistre,
- soit par désignation de l’expert à la suite d’un sinistre,
- soit par une des causes ordinaires d’interruption de la prescription :
* la reconnaissance par MMA de votre droit à bénéficier de la garantie contestée,
* un acte d’exécution forcée (exemples : commandement de payer, saisie),

*  une mesure conservatoire prise en application du code des procédures civiles d’exécution (exemple : 
saisie conservatoire),
*  l’exercice d’une action en justice y compris en référé, devant une juridiction incompétente ou en cas

Les causes d’interruption de la prescription sont celles prévues par l’article L.114 -2 du Code des assurances.

Elle peut être interrompue :  
 par l’une des causes ordinaires  d’interruption suivantes prévues par le Code civil :  
- la reconnaissance par le débiteur du droit du créancier (article 224 0 du Code c ivil),  
- une demande en justice, même en référé, même portée devant une juridiction incompétente ou annulée par l’effet d’un vice de 
procédure (article 2241 du Code civil), 
- une mesure conservatoire prise en application du Code des procédures civiles d’exécution ou un acte d’exécution forcée (article 
2244 du Code civil)  
 ainsi que dans les cas suivants :  
- la désignation d’un expert à la suite d’un sinistre ,

llm_answer.text:
**Interruption by Conservatory Measure**

* A conservatory measure is a provisional measure taken by a court to preserve the rights of a creditor or claimant before a final judgment is rendered.
* When a conservatory measure is imposed on the debtor's property, the prescription period is interrupted for the duration of the measure.
* The interruption begins from the date the measure is imposed and ends when the measure is lifted or expires.

**Interruption by Forced Execution Act**

* A forced execution act is a legal action taken by a creditor to enforce a judgment against the debtor's property.
* When a forced execution act is initiated, the prescription period is interrupted for the duration of the proceedings.
* The interruption begins from the date the act is initiated and ends when the proceedings are concluded or abandoned.

**Effects of Interruption**

* The interruption of the prescription period resets the time limit for the creditor to file a lawsuit or take other legal action to enforce their claim.
* The interruption applies to all claims that are subject to the conservatory measure or forced execution act.
* The interruption does not affect the underlying cause of action or the merits of the claim.

**Exceptions**

* In some jurisdictions, the prescription period may not be interrupted by conservatory measures or forced execution acts if the debtor is aware of the claim and has the opportunity to defend against it.
* The interruption may also not apply if the conservatory measure or forced execution act is later declared invalid or ineffective.

 La question est How is the prescription period interrupted by a conservatory measure or forced execution act?

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text:
**Interruption by Conservatory Measure**

* A conservatory measure is a provisional measure taken by a court to preserve the rights of a creditor or claimant before a final judgment is rendered.
* When a conservatory measure is imposed on the debtor's property, the prescription period is interrupted for the duration of the measure.
* The interruption begins from the date the measure is imposed and ends when the measure is lifted or expires.

**Interruption by Forced Execution Act**

* A forced execution act is a legal action taken by a creditor to enforce a judgment against the debtor's property.
* When a forced execution act is initiated, the prescription period is interrupted for the duration of the proceedings.
* The interruption begins from the date the act is initiated and ends when the proceedings are concluded or abandoned.

**Effects of Interruption**

* The interruption of the prescription period resets the time limit for the creditor to file a lawsuit or take other legal action to enforce their claim.
* The interruption applies to all claims that are subject to the conservatory measure or forced execution act.
* The interruption does not affect the underlying cause of action or the merits of the claim.

**Exceptions**

* In some jurisdictions, the prescription period may not be interrupted by conservatory measures or forced execution acts if the debtor is aware of the claim and has the opportunity to defend against it.
* The interruption may also not apply if the conservatory measure or forced execution act is later declared invalid or ineffective.

llm_answer.text:
According to the French Insurance Code (Code des assurances) article L114-2, the prescription period is interrupted by:

- a conservatory measure taken in application of the Code of Civil Enforcement Procedures (Code des procédures civiles d'exécution). An example given is a conservatory seizure (saisie conservatoire).

- a forced execution act (acte d'exécution forcée). Examples given are a formal demand for payment (commandement de payer) and a seizure (saisie).

So the prescription period is interrupted when the creditor takes a conservatory measure like a conservatory seizure against the debtor, or initiates a forced execution procedure like issuing a formal demand for payment or carrying out a seizure of the debtor's assets. These actions demonstrate the creditor is actively pursuing their claim, so they interrupt the running of the prescription period that would otherwise extinguish the claim.

llm_answer.text:
**Analysis of a Dispute**

**1. Gather Information:**
* Review policy documents, claim forms, and relevant correspondence.
* Interview the policyholder, claimant, and any witnesses.
* Obtain medical records, police reports, or other supporting documentation.

**2. Identify Key Issues:**
* Determine the nature of the dispute (e.g., coverage, liability, amount of damages).
* Identify the specific policy provisions or legal principles that apply.

**3. Evaluate Evidence:**
* Assess the credibility and reliability of witnesses and documents.
* Consider the medical evidence and any expert opinions.
* Determine the weight of evidence supporting each party's position.

**4. Legal Research:**
* Consult case law, statutes, and regulations to determine the applicable legal principles.
* Seek guidance from legal counsel if necessary.

**Decision-Making Process**

**1. Coverage Determination:**
* Determine whether the loss or damage is covered under the policy.
* Consider policy exclusions, limitations, and conditions.

**2. Liability Assessment:**
* Determine if the policyholder or insured is legally liable for the damages.
* Consider negligence, breach of contract, or other legal theories.

**3. Damage Assessment:**
* Calculate the amount of damages owed to the claimant.
* Consider medical expenses, lost wages, property damage, and other relevant factors.

**4. Settlement Negotiations:**
* Engage in negotiations with the claimant to reach a mutually acceptable settlement.
* Consider the strength of the insurer's case, the potential costs of litigation, and the claimant's needs.

**5. Litigation:**
* If a settlement cannot be reached, the insurer may file a lawsuit or defend against a lawsuit filed by the claimant.
* The court will determine the outcome of the dispute based on the evidence and applicable law.

**6. Payment or Denial:**
* If the insurer determines that the claim is valid, it will issue payment to the claimant.
* If the insurer denies the claim, it will provide a written explanation of the reasons for the denial.

**Factors Influencing Decision-Making:**

* Policy language
* Applicable laws and regulations
* Evidence and witness testimony
* Legal precedents
* Financial implications
* Customer satisfaction

 La question est How does the insurer handle the analysis of a dispute and decision-making process?

llm_answer.name: gemini/gemini-pro

items.text:
**Analysis of a Dispute**

**1. Gather Information:**
* Review policy documents, claim forms, and relevant correspondence.
* Interview the policyholder, claimant, and any witnesses.
* Obtain medical records, police reports, or other supporting documentation.

**2. Identify Key Issues:**
* Determine the nature of the dispute (e.g., coverage, liability, amount of damages).
* Identify the specific policy provisions or legal principles that apply.

**3. Evaluate Evidence:**
* Assess the credibility and reliability of witnesses and documents.
* Consider the medical evidence and any expert opinions.
* Determine the weight of evidence supporting each party's position.

**4. Legal Research:**
* Consult case law, statutes, and regulations to determine the applicable legal principles.
* Seek guidance from legal counsel if necessary.

**Decision-Making Process**

**1. Coverage Determination:**
* Determine whether the loss or damage is covered under the policy.
* Consider policy exclusions, limitations, and conditions.

**2. Liability Assessment:**
* Determine if the policyholder or insured is legally liable for the damages.
* Consider negligence, breach of contract, or other legal theories.

**3. Damage Assessment:**
* Calculate the amount of damages owed to the claimant.
* Consider medical expenses, lost wages, property damage, and other relevant factors.

**4. Settlement Negotiations:**
* Engage in negotiations with the claimant to reach a mutually acceptable settlement.
* Consider the strength of the insurer's case, the potential costs of litigation, and the claimant's needs.

**5. Litigation:**
* If a settlement cannot be reached, the insurer may file a lawsuit or defend against a lawsuit filed by the claimant.
* The court will determine the outcome of the dispute based on the evidence and applicable law.

**6. Payment or Denial:**
* If the insurer determines that the claim is valid, it will issue payment to the claimant.
* If the insurer denies the claim, it will provide a written explanation of the reasons for the denial.

**Factors Influencing Decision-Making:**

* Policy language
* Applicable laws and regulations
* Evidence and witness testimony
* Legal precedents
* Financial implications
* Customer satisfaction

manuscrite.

légale de conservation. Ainsi, l’assuré peut durant cette période, nous 
demander de lui adresser ces documents sous format électronique en se

Dispositifs amovibles permettant d’actionner un mécanisme d’ouverture et/ou de démarrage (y compris les cartes ou  badges à 
télécommande…).  
 
Conditions g énérales  
Présent document décrivant les garanties, les options proposées et le fonctionnement du contrat.  
 
Conditions p articulières et leurs annexes  
Documents délivrés lors de la souscription du contrat ou de sa modification (avenant) précisant notamment les caractéristique s du 
véhicule, le nom des conducteurs habituels ainsi que l’énoncé et le montant des garanties et des options souscrites. 

 Ces documents sont téléchargeables et imprimables.
19 BIS.1.6. Relation électronique
En choisissant la relation électronique, l’assuré accepte de recevoir 
exclusivement par voie électronique à l’adresse e-mail qu’il a renseignée, 
toute information, document ou communication susceptible de lui être 
adressés dans le cadre de la souscription et l’exécution de son contrat.
Cette relation électronique concerne tous les actes et communications 
que nous aurons dématérialisés. Il est précisé que certains actes ou 
communications peuvent être adressés à l’assuré sous format papier.
19 BIS.1.7. 

 ■Remise de vos documents originaux signés
Dès que les documents sont signés électroniquement par l’assuré, ils lui 
sont systématiquement envoyés par mail sur un support durable (Pdf) à 
l’adresse e-mail préalablement renseignée.
Ces documents sont téléchargeables et imprimables.
19 BIS.1.6. Relation électronique
En choisissant la relation électronique, l’assuré accepte de recevoir 
exclusivement par voie électronique à l’adresse e-mail qu’il a renseignée, 
toute information, document ou communication susceptible de lui être 
adressés dans le cadre de la souscription et l’exécution de son contrat.
Cette relation électronique concerne tous les actes et communications 
que nous aurons dématérialisés. 

 Si l’assuré souscrit son contrat par téléphone auprès de l’un de 
nos conseillers, ses réponses sont recueillies préalablement à toute 
souscription. Lorsqu’une date et heure sont indiquées en bas d’un 
document (telles les Conditions Personnelles), par la signature électronique 
de ce document l’assuré reconnaît que ce document a bien été établi à la 
date et heure indiquées.
Si l’assuré souscrit son contrat en ligne sur Internet, il doit renseigner 
ces informations lui-même. A tout moment, l’assuré peut retourner sur 
l’écran de consultation précédent afin de corriger une information inexacte.
• Présentation et remise des documents
Les documents précontractuels et contractuels sont présentés et remis à 
l’assuré sur un support électronique. 

 Conditions g énérales  
Présent document décrivant les garanties, les options proposées et le fonctionnement du contrat.  
 
Conditions p articulières et leurs annexes  
Documents délivrés lors de la souscription du contrat ou de sa modification (avenant) précisant notamment les caractéristique s du 
véhicule, le nom des conducteurs habituels ainsi que l’énoncé et le montant des garanties et des options souscrites.  
 
Conducteur expérimenté  
Personne qui a obtenu son permis de conduire depuis au moins 3 ans et qui peut justifier de 3 années d’assurance.  
 
Conducteur habituel  
Personne, titulaire du permis de conduire, autorisée par le souscripteur à conduire régulièreme nt le véhicule. Les conducteurs  
habituels doivent être désignés aux  conditions particulières . 

 CONDITIONS GÉNÉRALES  5 
Clefs du véhicule  
Dispositifs amovibles permettant d’actionner un mécanisme d’ouverture et/ou de démarrage (y compris les cartes ou  badges à
